name: Full input — NLP/Market Integrity pillar (fictional applicant)
description: Best-case input: all statistics, publications, expert names provided. Should produce near-publication-ready prose.

input.proposed_endeavor: Dr. Sarah Kim's proposed endeavor seeks to advance the national interest by addressing systemic challenges in U.S. financial markets through AI-powered regulatory tools and evidence-based financial analysis.
all_pillars: 1. Municipal Fiscal Stability — predictive models for local government tax revenue forecasting
2. Financial Market Integrity — NLP surveillance tools for detecting bias in analyst communications
3. Innovation Capital Allocation — patent valuation frameworks linking innovation quality to firm survival

pillar_details.problem: Optimistic bias in financial analyst reports persists after major regulatory interventions, misleading retail investors and distorting capital markets at national scale.
pillar_details.method: Natural Language Processing (NLP) pipeline for sentence-level tone and sentiment classification of financial analyst research reports
pillar_details.past_work: Primary author of dissertation chapter analyzing [N] analyst reports totaling [X] million words. First study to demonstrate affiliated analyst tone bias persists post-regulation. Open-source tool on GitHub. Best Paper Award Semifinalist at major finance conference. Under review at top-ranked finance journal.
pillar_details.future_plan: Three-phase plan: (1) Refine NLP model, (2) Build cloud-based regulatory dashboard, (3) Deploy with financial regulators.
statistics: [X] million U.S. households own mutual funds representing $[Y] trillion in assets
[Z]% of U.S. households hold retirement accounts
Investment fraud: $[Amount] billion in consumer losses in [Year]
Estimated [X]-[Y]% reduction in mispricing risk from NLP surveillance tool

expert_endorsements.name: Dr. Robert Chen
expert_endorsements.title: Professor of Computer Science
expert_endorsements.quote: careful, clearly communicated, and directly relevant to national-scale regulatory systems
expert_endorsements.noted: Called the NLP tool the first of its kind for detecting tone bias in analyst reports

expert_endorsements.name: Dr. Maria Santos
expert_endorsements.title: Professor and Department Head, Finance
expert_endorsements.quote: landmark contributions in the field of financial transparency — a pioneering framework for detecting systemic biases

expected_output: All three Dhanasar prongs covered with dedicated sections NLP methodology named specifically SEC and FINRA referenced as federal connections Future plan has 3+ phases with specific deliverables All prose in third person No hedging language Metadata JSON appended Placeholder statistics flagged with [PLACEHOLDER] if not real numbers

name: Full input — Patent valuation / Innovation Economy pillar (fictional applicant)
description: Strong input with expert endorsements. Tests IPO/innovation domain handling.

input.proposed_endeavor: Dr. Sarah Kim's proposed endeavor seeks to improve capital allocation to innovation-driven firms through evidence-based patent valuation frameworks.
all_pillars: 3. Innovation Capital Allocation — patent valuation frameworks

pillar_details.problem: Capital misallocation to innovation-driven firms because investors cannot distinguish economically valuable patents from scientifically novel but commercially unviable ones.
pillar_details.method: Survival analysis (Cox Proportional Hazards and Fine & Gray competing risks models) on large-scale IPO and patent datasets
pillar_details.past_work: Large-scale study of [N] U.S. IPO firms over [X] years. Key finding: economically valuable patents reduce firm delisting risk by [Y]%. Endorsed by independent experts in technology and finance.
pillar_details.future_plan: Four-phase plan: integrate patent/financial datasets, build predictive models, validate, deploy interactive platform for investors and regulators.
statistics: [N] U.S. IPO firms studied over [X] years
Economically valuable patents reduce delisting risk by [Y]%
IP-intensive industries account for [Z]% of U.S. economic activity
[N] million jobs directly supported by IP-intensive industries
CHIPS and Science Act: $39 billion invested in semiconductor R&D

expert_endorsements.name: Dr. Angela Wright
expert_endorsements.title: Assistant Professor of Computer Science
expert_endorsements.quote: a decision-ready framework to help steer equity capital toward companies more likely to endure and sustain employment

expert_endorsements.name: Dr. James Park
expert_endorsements.title: Assistant Professor of Finance, NSF grant PI
expert_endorsements.quote: provides a new, data-driven framework for assessing the long-term viability of innovation-driven firms

expected_output: Survival analysis methodology named specifically IPO firm count and timespan cited or flagged as placeholders Delisting risk reduction percentage highlighted Jobs statistic used in Prong 1 CHIPS Act referenced with dollar amount National security angle raised (foreign acquisition of U.S. tech) Future plan connects to SEC disclosure guidance and federal innovation funding

name: Incomplete input — gap detection test

all_pillars: 1. Healthcare Billing Fraud Detection using ML

pillar_details.problem: Healthcare billing fraud is a major problem in the US.
pillar_details.past_work: Working on a paper about this.

Skill asks for missing info before generating

name: Industry applicant — cybersecurity (non-academic, Pathway B)
description: Tests handling of industry professional where work products replace publications.

input.proposed_endeavor: Mr. David Chen proposes to develop advanced cybersecurity frameworks to protect U.S. critical infrastructure from state-sponsored attacks.
all_pillars: 1. Critical Infrastructure Threat Detection — ML anomaly detection for power grid systems

pillar_details.problem: State-sponsored cyberattacks on U.S. power grids and water systems are increasing. CISA has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors as national priorities.
pillar_details.method: ML-based anomaly detection using time-series analysis on SCADA system logs
pillar_details.past_work: Deployed anomaly detection system at a major U.S. utility covering [N] million customers. Detected [X] advanced persistent threat attempts in [Y] months. Employer issued formal statement confirming deployment.
pillar_details.future_plan: Develop open-source framework for smaller utilities; publish methodology with DHS/CISA collaboration.
statistics: Colonial Pipeline attack: $4.4 billion economic disruption (2021)
16 critical infrastructure sectors designated by CISA
$1.9 billion in CISA funding for infrastructure cybersecurity (FY2024)

expert_endorsements.quote: the most effective security tool we have deployed in 15 years
expert_endorsements.noted: Employer statement as Pathway B objective evidence
